column13:
Extension of accreditation with LGSETA, Service SETA, SASSETA and ETDP SETA –

- Received the letter of extension of accreditation from SASSETA
until 30 June 2024.
- Completed application forms for ETDPSETA. (Accreditation expired 31 March 2023).
- Completed online application for LGSETA (accreditation expired: 31 March 2023).
- Services SETA advised the NSG to apply for full qualifications (accreditation expired 30 June 2023)
column14:
The NQF landscape has undergone change which has implications for the NSG offerings.  The  QCTO has designed Occupational qualifications and part-qualifications which replaced most of the historical qualifications and unit standards which the NSG is accredited to offer. 

On 30 June 2023 SAQA de-registered all historical qualifications in terms of the Ministerial Determination  of the Qualifications Sub-Frameworks, no 44031. The NSG can only register the last cohort  of learners until 30 June 2024 where it has received extension of accreditation by the various SETAs. Therefore, the NSG must  apply for accreditation
column15:
The NSG has submitted applications for extension of accreditation to the various SETAs. The department is also working on the development of learning materials for occupational qualifications  to apply for accreditation by 31 March 2024. 

The NSG is engaged in checking the NQF for relevant qualifications that can replace the credit bearing unit standards
